meanings.definition: The first day of the month in the ancient Roman calendar.
meanings.sent1: On the calends, people in ancient Rome would make offerings to the gods.
meanings.sent2: The calends marked the beginning of a new month in the Roman calendar.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting the calends was like missing the start of a race.
meanings.sent4: The calends were like the opening act of a grand theatrical performance.
meanings.sent5: The calends were as important as the first page of a new book.

meanings.definition: The first day of any month in the ancient Roman calendar.
meanings.sent1: Celebrations were held on the calends of every month in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent2: People gathered at the forum on the calends to discuss upcoming events.
meanings.sent3: Missing the calends meant missing the chance to reset for the new month.
meanings.sent4: The calends were like the fresh start button on a monthly cycle.
meanings.sent5: The calends were as anticipated as the first light of dawn on a new day.
